attributes.action: challenge the Office of National Statistics (ONS) position on including a series of questions in the 2011 census regarding the personal details of overnight guests in private homes.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The proposed questions regarding the names, sex and birth dates of overnight guests can only be seen as a gross invasion of privacy and one for which no explanation has been issued other than that it is 'in the public interest'.  Surely this type of data collection is not consistent with nor necessary to fulfil the census agenda of obtaining a picture of demographic and social changes. If these questions are to be asked then the British public has a right to know exactly what this information will be used for and why.
